oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practitioners Experience with Mycoplasma bovis Outbreaks: Dairy Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gawthrop, Jan C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mycoplasma bovis
medical management
dairy calves
vaccinate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mycoplasma bovis infection in dairy calves is a very common problem that requires all the common principles of good medical management. Reduce exposure, detect early, treat properly, feed and house optimally and vaccinate if necessary. More knowledge on management of this disease is surely needed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 11
